title: Jason Williams (rugby league, born 1981)
text:
Jason Williams (born 21 January 1981) is a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer and <a href="heavyweight%20boxer">heavyweight boxer</a> who currently plays for the <a href="Glenora%20Bears">Glenora Bears</a> in the <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League">Auckland Rugby League</a>. His position of choice is at .
Early years.
Williams was born in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, New Zealand, he attended <a href="Mount%20Albert%20Grammar">Mount Albert Grammar</a> and represented the New Zealand Secondary Schools and the <a href="Junior%20Kiwis">Junior Kiwis</a> in 1998.
He then played for the <a href="Marist%20Richmond%20Brothers">Marist Richmond Brothers</a> in the <a href="Bartercard%20Cup">Bartercard Cup</a>.
Playing career.
Williams signed with the <a href="Cronulla%20Sharks">Cronulla Sharks</a> in 2004. However he was charged with an assault on teammate <a href="Jeremy%20Smith%20%28rugby%20league%20born%201981%29">Jeremy Smith</a>, who was left with a fractured cheekbone, he was remanded in custody without bail for 4 months but then got bail in the Supreme Courts and later had the charges dropped with no conviction. . Williams was released after just over three months due to good behavior and decided to take up boxing.
However <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> general manager <a href="Don%20Furner">Don Furner</a> offered him a contract and Williams ended up playing three seasons with the Raiders between 2005/06/07.
Williams then joined the <a href="Wynnum%20Manly%20Seagulls">Wynnum Manly Seagulls</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> for the 2008/2009 seasons before joining the East Tigers. At the time the Seagulls and Easts were a feeder club to the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>.
Later years and Boxing.
Williams returned to Sydney from Queensland to focus on a <a href="boxing">boxing</a> career. His first professional fight was in 2010 when he lost to John Szigeti at the <a href="Gold%20Coast%20Convention%20Centre">Gold Coast Convention Centre</a> on 4 December.
In 2011 Williams returned to New Zealand and joined the <a href="Te%20Atatu%20Roosters">Te Atatu Roosters</a> in the <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League">Auckland Rugby League</a> competition before leaving the club and joining the <a href="Glenora%20Bears">Glenora Bears</a>. In June Williams appeared on the undercard of the <a href="Sonny%20Bill%20Williams">Sonny Bill Williams</a>' Clash for Canterbury. Williams defeated his opponent, Kris O'Neil, by knock-out in the second round.
